name: America

leader.name: Teddy Roosevelt
leader.ability: Units receive +5 <Combat Strength> Combat Strength on their home continent. +1 Appeal to all tiles in a city with a National Park. Gain the Rough Rider unique unit with Rifling.

ability: All Diplomatic policy slots in the current government are converted to Wildcard policy slots. Gains +1 <Diplomatic Favor> Diplomatic Favor per turn for every Wildcard slot in their government.

unit.name: P-51 Mustang
special: +5 <Combat Strength> Combat Strength vs. fighters, +50% experience gain

unit.name: Rough Rider

effects: +1 <Great Artist> Great Artist Point, +2 <Great Musician> Great Musician Points
After Modern Era: +100% <Tourism> Tourism pressure from this city towards other civilizations

name: Arabia

leader.name: Saladin
leader.ability: The Worship building for Arabia's Religion can be purchased at 10% of the usual <Faith> Faith cost, and grants Arabian cities with it +10% <Science> Science, <Faith> Faith, and <Culture> Culture.

ability: Automatically receives the final <Great Prophet> Great Prophet when the next-to-last one is claimed (if one has not been earned already). +1 <Science> Science per foreign city following Arabia's Religion.

infrastructure.name: Madrasa
effects: Provides Faith Faith equal to the adjacency bonus of the <Campus> Campus

name: Australia

leader.name: John Curtin
leader.ability: +100% <Production> Production in all cities for the next 10 turns after being declared war upon or liberating a city.

ability: +3 <Housing> Housing in coastal cities. Building a Pasture triggers a Culture Bomb, claiming surrounding tiles. <Campus> Campus, <Commercial Hub> Commercial Hub, <Holy Site> Holy Site, and <Theater Square> Theater Square districts gain +1 to their yields in tiles with Charming Appeal, and +3 in tiles with Breathtaking Appeal.

unit.name: Digger
special: +10 <Combat Strength> Combat Strength on Coastal Tiles

infrastructure.name: Outback Station
effects: Steam Power: +1 <Production> Production to every adjacent Pasture, +1 <Production> Production from every adjacent Outback Station
Rapid Deployment: +1 <Food> Food from every 2 adjacent Outback Stations

leader.name: Montezuma
leader.ability: Improved Luxury resources provide an <Amenity> Amenity to 2 extra cities. +1 <Combat Strength> Combat Strength for all units for each different improved Luxury resource in Aztec territory.

ability: Can spend Builder Charges to complete 20% of a district's <Production> Production cost.

unit.name: Eagle Warrior
special: Turns defeated enemy units into builders

leader.name: Pedro II

ability: Rainforest tiles provide a +1 adjacency bonus for <Campus> Campuses, <Commercial Hub> Commercial Hubs, <Holy Site> Holy Sites, and <Theater Square> Theater Squares, and provide +1 Appeal to adjacent tiles, instead of the usual -1.

name: Canada

leader.name: Wilfred Laurier
leader.ability: Can build Farms on Tundra tiles, and on Tundra Hills tiles with Civil Engineering. Snow, Snow Hills, Tundra Hills, and Tundra tiles cost 50% less Gold to purchase. On those tiles, resources accumulate twice as fast, Mines and Lumber Mills receive +1 <Production> Production and Camps receive +1 <Food> Food.

ability: Cannot declare Surprise Wars or war on City-States. Surprise Wars cannot be declared on Canada. For every 100 <Tourism> Tourism earned, gain 1 <Diplomatic Favor> Diplomatic Favor. +100% <Diplomatic Favor> Diplomatic Favor gained from successfully completing Emergencies or Scored Competitions.

unit.name: Mountie

name: China

leader.name: Qin Shi Huang
leader.ability: Builders receive an additional build charge. Can spend Builder charges to complete 15% of the <Production> Production cost for Ancient and Classical wonders. <Canal> Canals are unlocked with Masonry, instead of Steam Power.

ability: <Eureka> Eurekas and <Inspiration> Inspirations provide an extra 10% of the <Science> Science and <Culture> Culture cost for researching technologies and civics.

ability: Gains +1 <Trade Route> Trade Route capacity and a free <Trader> Trader with Pottery. Unclaimed tiles within three tiles of a Cree city come under Cree control when a <Trader> Trader first moves into them.

name: Scotland

leader.name: Robert the Bruce
leader.ability: Can declare a War of Liberation with Defensive Tactics, instead of Diplomatic Service. +100% <Production> Production in all cities and +2 <Movement> Movement for all units for the next 10 turns after declaring a War of Liberation.

ability: Happy cities gain +5% <Science> Science and +5% <Production> Production, and generate +1 <Great Scientist> Great Scientist Points in their <Campus> Campuses and +1 <Great Engineer> Great Engineer Points in their <Industrial Zone> Industrial Zones. Ecstatic cities double these bonuses.

unit.name: Highlander
unit.strength: Combat Strength: 50 vs. 45, Ranged Strength: 65 vs. 60
special: +5 <Combat Strength> Combat Strength in Hills and Woods

infrastructure.name: Golf Course
effects: +1 <Culture> Culture if adjacency to a City Center
+1 <Culture> Culture if adjacent to an <Entertainment Complex> Entertainment Complex
Tiles with Golf Courses cannot be swapped

name: Scythia

leader.name: Tomyris
leader.ability: Can declare a War of Liberation with Defensive Tactics, instead of Diplomatic Service. +100% <Production> Production in all cities and +2 <Movement> Movement for all units for the next 10 turns after declaring a War of Liberation.

ability: Building a light cavalry unit or Saka Horse Archer grants a free second copy of that unit.

name: Spain

leader.name: Phillip II
leader.ability: All units receive +4 <Combat Strength> Combat Strength against civilizations following a different Religion. Inquisitors have one extra use of their Remove Heresy ability. Inquisitors eliminate 100% of the presence of other Religions.

ability: +2 Loyalty per turn for cities outside their home continent if they have a Mission adjacent to the City Center.

unit.name: Conquistador
special: +10 <Combat Strength> Combat Strength when same tile with a religious unit

infrastructure.name: Mission
effects: +2 <Faith> Faith if on a continent different from your Capital
+2 <Science> Science if built next to a <Campus> Campus

name: Sumeria

leader.name: Gilgamesh
leader.ability: May declare war on anyone at war with his allies without incurring warmonger penalties. When at war with a common foe, Sumerian and allied units share pillage rewards and combat experience if within 5 tiles of each other. Gains Alliance Points per turn for being at war with a common foe.

ability: Capturing a Barbarian Outpost also grants a Tribal Village reward. May levy city-state units at 50% of the usual <Gold> Gold cost.

unit.name: War-Cart
special: No combat penalties against anti-cavalry units
+1 <Movement> Movement if starting in open terrain

infrastructure.name: Ziggurat
effects: +1 <Culture> Culture if adjacent to a River

name: Sweden

leader.name: Kristina
leader.ability: Buildings with at least three Great Work slots and wonders with at least two Great Work slots are automatically themed when all slots are filled. Gains the Queen's Bibliotheque unique building in the <Government Plaza> Government Plaza.

ability: Gains 50 <Diplomatic Favor> Diplomatic Favor whenever a Great Person is earned. +1 <Great Engineer> Great Engineer Points from Factories and +1 <Great Scientist> Great Scientist Points from Universities. Sweden's presence in the game adds three unique World Congress competitions in the Industrial Era.

unit.name: Carolean
special: +10 <Combat Strength> Combat Strength per point of unused <Movement> Movement

infrastructure.name: Open-Air Museum
effects: +2 <Culture> Culture and +2 <Tourism> Tourism for each different type of terrain in which at least one Swedish city is founded
Tiles with Open-Air Museums cannot be swapped

name: Zulu

leader.name: Shaka
leader.ability: May form Corps with Mercenaries, instead of Nationalism, and Armies with Nationalism, instead of Mobilization. Corps and Armies gain an additional + <Combat Strength> Combat Strength.

ability: Capturing a city will upgrade the conquering unit into a Corps or Army, if the necessary civics are unlocked. +3 Loyalty per turn to cities with a garrisoned unit, increasing to +5 if the garrisoned unit is a Corps or Army.

infrastructure.name: Ikanda
effects: 25% faster training of Corps and Armies
Allows Corps and Armies to be built without the Miilitary Academy building
